item.title: Report E-2023040676
item.description:
Report E-2023040676

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-27
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN3266 MasterCare Pro-Blue release from 4 boxes each containing (2) 1-gallon poly jugs. XPO personnel advised approximately 1-gallon of product released to the other boxes and the dock due to the box being crushed and placed all waste into a metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to correctly containerize the waste. Contractors arrived onsite and transferred the corrosive waste to include the impacted boxes, jugs of product, and absorbents from the metal drum into a 55-gallon poly drum. The metal drum was decontaminated for future use. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

UPON INSPECTION THE BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS AND THE SEAL ALONG SIDE OF THE BODY OF THE BOTTLES HAD CRACKED AND LEAKED AS WELL. SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PROPER PPE AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THE BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS AND THE SEAL ALONG SIDE OF THE BODY OF THE BOTTLES HAD CRACKED AND LEAKED AS WELL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PROPER PPE AND PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. 2. X-2023040977 SequenceEvent: HAZMAT BOX FOUND LEAKING AND CORRODED. UPON INSPECTION THE BOTTLES INSIDE HAD LOOSE CAPS AND ONE OF THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING ALONG THE SEAL WHERE THE TOP OF THE LIDS CLOSE. SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PPE AND DAMAGE PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: THE BOTTLES INSIDE HAD LOOSE CAPS AND ONE OF THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING ALONG THE SEAL WHERE THE TOP OF THE LIDS CLOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH PPE AND DAMAGE PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2023040559
item.description:
Report E-2023040559

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-21
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN1824 Pre Soak 360 C release from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 28' x 5' area of the trailer floor and a 28' x 8' area of the concrete lot below due to a puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023040470
item.description:
Report E-2023040470

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-03
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 3, 2023, three (3) 2-gallon pails of corrosive part A/B were damaged due to a lack of dunnage during transportation and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to assess and remediate the site. HES personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all UN2735 impacted material in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: LEAKING BOX FOUND ON DOCK. UPON INSPECTION, ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE WAS MISSING A CAP AND HAD LEAKED OUT INTO THE BOX. AS I CHECKED THE OTHER BOTTLE CAPS, I FOUND THAT ALL OF THEM WERE REALLY LOOSE. I TIGHTENED THE CAPS AND THE SPILL WAS VERY SMALL, BUT IT WAS STILL CLEANED WITH PROPER PPE. THE DAMAGE WAS PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE WAS MISSING A CAP AND HAD LEAKED OUT INTO THE BOX. AS I CHECKED THE OTHER BOTTLE CAPS, I FOUND THAT ALL OF THEM WERE REALLY LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I TIGHTENED THE CAPS AND THE SPILL WAS VERY SMALL, BUT IT WAS STILL CLEANED WITH PROPER PPE. THE DAMAGE WAS PLACED IN SALVAGE DRUM.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T21:08:24+00:00

  • City: POOLER
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 4, 2023, at 1700 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Pooler, Georgia regarding the release of approximately 1 gallon of Sparclean Sanitizer 54 (Corrosive liquids, n.o.s., (contains sodium hypochlorite), UN1760, 8, III) and 1 gallon of Shineline Emulsifier (Corrosive liquids, n.o.s., (contains sodium hypochlorite), UN1760, 8, II). The release was contained to a 5 x 5 area of the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The affected cargo, released product, and all other waste generated were containerized in (1) 95-gallon poly drum, (4) 55-gallon poly drums and (1) 30-gallon poly drum. The waste drums were then transported by contractors off site for proper disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2023040212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-07
  • City: CONLEY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A tote of UN1866 has been damaged by an 086 forklift blade when the tote was being repositioned on the 086 dock. The tote had a leak out the top of the tote when the tote is positioned on its side to move the puncture hole (1.5 inches) to the top side of the tote. 086 is attempted to fill the punc ture hole with shrinkwrap to stop the leak in the side of the tote. The tote was to be positioned in a tilted position to prevent leaking out the top bung on the tote and the puncture hole on the side of the tote. The plastic shrinkwrap that is being used to plug the puncture hole in the side of t he tote has slowed the spill from the puncture hole to a steady drip. 086 requested an immediate call for a HM cleanup team. ~~HazMat Spill Response Crew was dispatched to the location.~~NOTE: 086 had a tote from 04/06/2023, on the same shipment, that was leaking around the duct tape patch job done by the spill team from 04/06/2023. This leak is a slow drip.~~Summary: At this time on the 086 dock we have the tote from yesterday (4-6-23, Thursday) that is still dripping out the spill team cleanup. The second leaking tote is dripping out the puncture hole from Friday, 4-7-23. 086 is requeste d animmediate call to a HM cleanup team for both leaking totes located on the 086 dock. 086 is using staydry to control the slow spillage coming from both totes.

  • Description: On March 30, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of low-foam detergent (UN3266) experienced a faulty lid and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the lid of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted surface. AOTC personnel overpacked damaged drum into one (1) 95-gallon overpack as hazardous waste. The crew then utilized absorbent wipes to remove all UN3266 from the lid of the drum. All low-foam detergent impacted material was containerized in the same (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

  • Description: Truck was involved in an accident. Log truck overturned in front of our truck. We struck the overturned trailer. The freight shifted, causing one of the valves to crack open, losing around 20 gallons of product. A cleanup crew (Hepaco) was called in to mitigate the incident. They unloaded the freight from the trailer, found a tote that had shifted and the drain valve partially open. They closed the valve. They then cleaned the spilled product in the trailer and roadway, and transported it back to their business for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023030777
item.description:
Report E-2023030777

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-05T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-31
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 03/31/2023 at 0947 hours EST CSXT personnel in the Southover Yard (Savannah, GA) discovered PROX77233, a loaded tank car of Xylene leaking from bottom of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Eastman Chemical Company, was notified. HEPACO, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found product leaking from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). HEPACO's assessment of the BOV found that product leaking through the body of the valve despite the valve being in the fully closed position. Responders were able to tighten the secondary closure cap on the BOV assembly one full turn using a wrench; this tightening of the secondary closure cap stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative (Lauren Bailey 903-738-4160). PROX77233 was held out of transportation pending load transfer, clean and purge, and receipt of OTMA.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 10, 2023, at 1458 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation personnel in Decatur, Georgia regarding the release of approximately 5 gallons of CAS210 FR (Toxic Liquid, Organic, n.o.s. (Dichloromethane) UN2810, 6.1, III) from (2) 5-gallon plastic pails. The release was reportedly due to a forklift puncture. No drains or waterways were reported as affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The released product, damaged pails and all other waste generated were containerized in (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste drums were then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Description: On March 09, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint (UN1263) was crushed during transit and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the wooden pallet and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to assess and remediate the site. HES personnel utilized degreasing agents and absorbent pads to remove the free-standing product. All paint impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023030510
item.description:
Report E-2023030510

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-23
  • City: ALBANY
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Dana Companies
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 13:36 PM ET, Dana Transport contacted the ERTS to report a spill that occurred over the road at 1737 Clark Ave, in Albany, GA, near the intersection of Turnip Field and Clark. It was estimated to be 20 gallons of turpentine, which occurred when the wash cap on the dome lid came loose and caused the contents to slosh out during transport. It was reported the spill was about a mile long and had impacted the asphalt. No storm drains or waterways were affected. ERTS dispatched AOTC to assess the impacted area. ERTS also spoke to Fire Chief Steve Brown who was on site managing responders and stated that a mile of the roadway was impacted. Before AOTC arrivied Fire Chief James Brown advised that GA DOT requested to cancel the call due to the product evaporating. No drains or waterways were impacted, and no waste was generated.

item.title: Report E-2023030303
item.description:
Report E-2023030303

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-11
  • City: Macon
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIR PRODUCTS AND CHEMICALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sat 11 Feb ~ 2230 driver called stating liquid coming out of vent due to the PBC would not fully close. The driver had offloaded ~ load at his first stop & had driven 2 hrs north on I-75 in the Macon Ga area. Once the driver was in an area on I-75 where visibility was clear, streetlights, he noticed more than just vapor coming from the rear of the trailer. He exited I-75 to an area where he could have more visibility on the situation. Upon review the PBC was stuck open. After multiple unsuccessful attempts to close the valve, he maneuvered to a safer location. The driver found an area with concert to park over and out of travel lanes to better handle the situation. Management made the decision to contact the fire department to maintain control over the area & dispatched a shop mechanic & empty trailer. At 0030 the trailer had successfully been offloaded and area cleared. No injuries or disruption to the I-75 corridor. Site Supervisor was the first to arrive on scene. With the assistance of FD, the PBC valve was thawed out & ~ 3 revolutions were turned on the valve to close. The valve was felt to be in the closed position however liquid continued to vent. Upon removal of the PBC valve at the Conyers Terminal a nut & bolt assembly was found in the piping.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal NRG contacted ERTS to report an estimated 15-gallon spill of UN3266 "Power Foam Cl NP (AFCO 5333)" that was released from one 55-gallon poly drum believed to have been punctured by a nail impacting the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to an 8' x 10' area of the trailer floor and 50' x 6" area of the asphalt lot below the trailer due to a nail puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: Conley
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX CUSTOM CRITICAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When the driver completed her post-trip inspection after arriving at a secure parking location, she found that more coolant from the tank attached to the lithium battery had leaked. This package had a leak noticed prior to departure that we were advised came from a cracked cap (report # E-2023020267). When the hazmat certified vendor we contacted when on-site they found that there was an unsealed vent on the coolant tank and that's where this leak was coming from. The vendor drained the remaining coolant, cleaned the material from in/around the freight/cargo box and left absorbent pads around the item just in case there was residue they couldn't capture/drain. There was no release of material outside of the cargo box. The consignee accepted the freight as it was.

R+L retained Cura Emergency Services LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to complete the necessary remedial actions. item.title: Report E-2023020050
item.description:
Report E-2023020050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-02
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0910 ET, XPO Logistics terminal NSA contacted the call center to report a spill in Savanah GA. XPO advised that during unloading, dunnage on other freight punctured the tote near the bottom causing a 1-gallon to release of UN3082, Saret SR517, onto the concrete dock floor from a 275 gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to the concrete dock floor in a 10' x 10' area due to improper loading and a puncture caused by other freight. Oil Dri was deployed and worked into the impacted area. The material was transferred into a new tote. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023020461
item.description:
Report E-2023020461

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-25
  • City: DORAVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS PROPANE, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1/25/2023 - Discovered a leak at the internal valve while it was in the open position. The attempt to tighten the packing nut (gasket) on the internal valve failed, so it was turned off which stopped the leak completely. The system was left off and was locked out and tagged out to ensure no one could re-energize the liquid line. The pnuematic line going to the internal valve was also disconnected to ensure that the acuator could not be filled back with air. 1/30/2023 - System was briefly unlocked and monitored while the remaining liquid was withdrawn from the tank. 2/8/2023-2/10/2023 - Contractor flared off the remaining vapor in the tank and replaced the leaking internal valve with a brand new internal valve. When replacing, it was noted that the packing inside the valve had been damaged by being tightened to many times. The facility had leaks in the past that they stopped by tightening the packing, but did not replace the internal valve.

item.title: Report X-2023010900
item.description:
Report X-2023010900

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered at the end of the non conveyable belt in load area 6 by a package handler. Once discovered, the area was cleared at minimum 20 feet for 20 minutes after the drum was recovered and placed in a 20 Gallon HazMat drum to let the area vent out. Proper PPE was used while recovering he drum and the spilled substance was covered and surrounded by sand and later cleaned up and put inside the 20 gallon drum with the damaged package. The damaged package was not upright and was leaking from the cap when discovered. DescribePack: cap failure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was recovered and placed in a 20 Gallon HazMat drum and sand was put on top and surrounded the spilled fluid to prevent further spread. The area was cleared to mitigate any inhalation of the vapors and to vent the area out. the sand was recovered and also put in the 20 gallon drum

item.title: Report E-2023010385
item.description:
Report E-2023010385

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-27
  • City: FAIRBURN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX INTERMODAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/27/2022 at 2208hrs personnel with CSX Intermodal Fairburn GA Terminal discovered TCNU495504, a loaded container of 1 T/L FREIGHT ALL KINDS, (FAK) DATA COMUNICATION DEVICES, released less than 1 pint of a burgundy fluid and was steaming from a vent on top of the trailer with minimal amount onto asphalt pavement. The container lading was both NonHaz and HazMat. The container was isolated and the local Fire Dept was notified, report# To Be Provided. The shipper, ZIM AMERICAN INTEGRATED SHIPNG representative was notified by CSX Intermodal Customer Service; case#00590974. CSX emergency response contractor, HULLS Environmental, was dispatched to the scene; secured the contaminated areas, deconned spilled areas, and cleaned up the release site. The original freight trailer was released to the rail shipper. The issue was identified as inadequate packaging, and improper loading method, to prevent lading self-ignition. Issue also identified as non-compliant lading description as nonhaz Freight All Kinds, when inner labels showed lading as UN3480, Lithium Ion Batteries, Class 9. Corrective actions were communicated to the shipper along with request to provide compliant, or exemption, documentation for the lading description.

  • Description: On December 15, 2022, one (1) 5-gallon pail containing UN2735 was forked during unloading and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer floor and wooden pallets. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to complete the necessary remedial actions. HES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all UN2735-impacted materials in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: On December 13, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Uniquat QAC-50 (UN2920) was punctured during the unloading process and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. HES personnel utilized neutralizer and hand tools to collect all UN2920-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal.

  • Description: On December 9, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of furfuryl alcohol (UN2874) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the dock floor. R+L personnel retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental (HE) to complete the necessary corrective actions. RLC personnel deployed granular absorbents to the spill and overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal prior to HE's arrival. HE personnel arrived on site and deployed more granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools. The crew then containerized all UN2874-impacted material in the same 95-gallon overpack for disposal in RLC's facility waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2022120447
item.description:
Report E-2022120447

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-09
  • City: BRYON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0934 ET, XPO terminal NMA reported a spill that was found in a trailer and has moved onto the dock in Byron, GA. The spill consisted of a 330-gallon plastic tote containing Spectrum RX 9800, which was found leaking inside the trailer due to what looks like a forklift blade puncture prior to arrival, causing approximately a total of 5 gallons to release inside the trailer and on the dock. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to the trailer, dock, and concrete lot below in a combined area of 20' x 20' due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote and all cleanup debris were containerized into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was using safe and proper handling techniques when they noticed the package leaking during handling. QA rep was sent to contain and rectify leakage. Absorbent was used to mitigate the encroachment of the liquid while simultaneously putting box in red FedEx ground tote to prevent further uncontrolled leaking and to prepare package for damaged HAZMAT processing in HAZMAT cage. DescribePack: The seal of the cap on jerrican was not fully sealed around opening which led to the internal leaking of the jerrican. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent was used to absorb the HAZMAT liquid while the package was also placed in a red FedEx Ground tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023010203
item.description:
Report E-2023010203

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-18
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 18, 2022, ERTS was contacted by Landstar personnel in Hampton, Georgia requesting facilitation of the cleanup of an oven cleaner release. ERTS then dispatched contractors to manage all onsite cleanup activities. Following contractor arrival and assessment of the involved cargo, it was determined that approximately (2.5) gallons of Retail Clean-In-Place Oven Cleaner (Potassium hydroxide, solution, 8, II) was released to a 3 x 3 area of the trailer floor. The release is presumed to have been caused by a faulty container top. Contractors cleaned up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged freight, spent absorbents and all other waste generated were containerized in (1) 55-gallon plastic drum and 35 cardboard boxes of damaged freight. The waste containers were taken to the contractor's facility for proper disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-15
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The DGMG received notification on 1 1/17/22 that an Adhesive(UNI 133; AWB 6865352) shipped undeclared on 11/15/22 from ATL to JFK. This event was coordinated through Cabin Maintenance, and the affected DG part was placed in the same box as the non-DG part(light). This event remains under investigation and long-term comprehensive corrective actions are being developed.

item.title: Report E-2022120649
item.description:
Report E-2022120649

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-21
  • City: DALTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 21, 2022, Landstar Inway reported a release of UN2796, Sulfuric Acid that resulted in the asphalt parking lot and a soil lot being impacted. Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel stated that a company by the name of MEI was on scene cleaning the release that had been dispatched by the county. The Hepaco supervisor remained onsite to supervise the cleanup; however Hepaco crew stood down. MEI personnel located and determined that three (3) totes had been damaged due to improper preparation for transit that resulted in the cargo to shift/rolled over. MEI personnel stated that 650 gallons of material had been released that mostly impacted the asphalt parking lot in a 60 yard by 20 yard area. MEI deployed Soda Ash and dirt to contain the released material. The remaining material in the damaged totes was transferred to two (2) new totes. MEI personnel pressure washed the bottom of the trailer and then reloaded the cargo. After the trailer was moved, the contractor used a street sweeper to recover the soil, soda ash and impacted wash water on the parking lot and place into one (1) roll-off box and transported offsite for disposal. On November 22, 2022, a second clean-up was requested by Landstar Inway. Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel used a pressure washer to clean the totes and the trailer of debris/residue. Two (2) 55-gallon poly drums of absorbents used to recover the wash water were generated and transported offsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022120360
item.description:
Report E-2022120360

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-24
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0149 ET, XPO Logistics requested a team to respond to a 20-gallon spill of UN2735 "Polycat 17" from a 55-gallon metal drum on the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of Polycat 17 released to an 8' x 2' area of the trailer floor and a 2' x 2' area of the asphalt lot below. Crew advised the first drum to be found damaged was dented in at the seam due to unknown reasons. The second damaged drum located had a crack near the bottom. Each drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO terminal NAT contacted ERTS to report a hazardous cargo release. It was reported a 55 gallon metal drum containing UN1210 "NoBleed Red D947 " was punctured on the loading dock, resulting in half a gallon of product releasing to the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS and determined terminal personnel were capable of conducting clean up. The damaged drum and all cleanup debris were containerized into a 95-gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to the cardboard packaging only due to a puncture. The damaged jug, impacted cardboard and absorbents were containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On November 10, 2022, four (4) one-gallon bottles of coating solution were crushed during loading and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to complete the necessary corrective actions. HES personnel utilized absorbent wipes and degreaser to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all coating solution-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: Driver said the hose started to buck and bucked the fitting off of the drop valve. Driver attempted to put it back on, but it kept spilling so he shut off the external valve. About 25-35 gallons of DEI spilled onto the ground. Driver claims he calculated the the product would fit. QT has their own environmental clean-up crew en-route to clean up the spill. Driver has the spill blocked at the curb line but some did enter the storm drain. It was later determined that Driver touched the drop fitting with his foot releasing the lock handle. He did not immediately shut off the external valve.

  • City: STOCKBRIDGE

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 16, 2022, Landstar truck #515818 reported a vehicle rollover that was carrying hazardous freight. The fire department arrived onsite and stated that the totes were leaking and requested a contractor response team. Hepaco was dispatched to the site and reported that 3 totes of UN1790 (Gardobond Additive H 7269), 4 totes of UN3264 (Gardobond X 4591 A), and 6 totes of non-hazardous Gardoclean S 5201 U were reported damaged. Hepaco personnel generated three (3) 55-gallon poly drums of liquid waste, one (1) 55-gallon poly drum of solid waste, and four (4) cubic yard boxes of neutralized materials containing impacted absorbents.

  • Description: On October 27, 2022, four (4) cans of denatured alcohol (UN1987) were punctured by a forklift during unloading and released approximately two (2) quarts of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to complete the necessary corrective actions. MEG personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all denatured alcohol-impacted material into three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-06
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal NAT called in to report a spill of UN2796 Dilute Sulfuric Acid 35% from 5-gallon bladder boxes caused by a forklift puncture that impacted their trailer floor and concrete beneath it. ERTS dispatched Miller Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 2125 ET, Miller personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 20' x 8' area of the trailer floor and a 25' x 10' area of the asphalt lot below the trailer. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas. All cleanup debris and the damaged box of product were collected and containerized into three 55-gallon poly drums. The waste were staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-03
  • City: CARTERSVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 163 4ET, XPO Logistics terminal NRG called to report a release of Phosphoric acid solution, that had impacted the trailer and dock concrete due to a puncture. ERTS dispatched Hull's Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 2015 ET, Hull's personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 gallons of product released to a 5' x 5' area in the trailer and on the dock floor. Hull's Environmental recovered the released product with absorbents and neutralized the area. Crew then transferred the remainder of the product to two new totes. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents and cleanup debris into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO terminal NAT reported a release of 42 gallons of "PureSolv Isopropyl Alcohol" (UN1219) after a pallet punctured a 42-gallon poly drum during dock operations. ERTS dispatched Miller Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 0625 ET, Miller personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 42-gallons of product released to a 6' x 6' area of the dock floor due to a pallet puncturing the drum. The damaged drum was placed into a 95 gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas, collected, and containerized into (3) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • City: BRASELTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at our facility already damaged. The package was knocked off the pallet and overturned with a mass amount of the corrosive material around the trailer. Upon inspection of damage, two caps were completely off the bottles and the other two bottles were dented and leaking as well. Proper PPE and safety hazmat equipment was used to clean up the corrosive spill and the damage was placed in salvage drum. DescribePack: Upon inspection of damage, two caps were completely off the bottles and the other two bottles were dented and leaking as well. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Proper PPE and safety hazmat equipment was used to clean up the corrosive spill and the damage was placed in salvage drum. The trailer was then sent to the yard with door open to air out fumes and to let it properly dry before the trailer was safe enough to continue to be unloaded.

  • Description: Fuel Pump(UN3363) was transported by air to SAN undeclared on FLT#992 18SEP22 AWB#64574764. The fuel pump was placed in the incorrect box. The agent processed the incorrect parts request(Pick Ticket) that was for the fuel pump instead of the gas mask. Preliminary Root Cause -Human Factors- The initial return document created by the ATG Hangar was switched with a non-dangerous good part, mask, and routed in error -Complacency-The team member receiving and shipping the part failed to follow the process to validate the part against the ticket The event remains under investigation. .'. I

  • Description: On September 1, 2022, one (1) 1.32 gallon pail of hydrogen peroxide was damaged during transit and released approximately 0.085 gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to complete the necessary corrective actions. MEG personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all impacted-solids and the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2022100271
item.description:
Report X-2022100271

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-19
  • City: ROSWELL
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE ON ONE OF THE DRIVER'S VEHICLE. UPON ARRIVAL THE DRIVER STATED THAT HE BELIEVED A SHIPPER WAS IMPROPERLY SHIPPING HAZMATS. NOTICED WHITE BOXES WITH A GREEN DIAMOND LABEL GOING INTO UNMARKED BOXES THAT HE PICKED UP. RESPONDER MOVED THE BOXES TO THE HAZMAT AUDITING AREA AND OPENED THEM. THE BOXES CONTAINED TWO INTERIOR BOXES WITH A CLASS 2 NON-FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL ON THE SIDE OF THE BOXES. RESPONDER OPNED THE OTHER BOXES AND ALL HAD THE SAME TWO BOXES WITH DIAMOND LABELS ON THEM INSIDE. THEN CONTACTED THE HAZMAT SUPPORT DESK AND WAS INSTRUCTED TAKE PICTURES ON 6-SIDES, TO ISOLATE THE PACKAGES FOR INVESTIGATION, AND COMPLETE UNDECLARED HAZMAT FORMS IN ETT. PACKAGES ARE BEING KEPT IN HAZMAT AUDITING AREA. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1Z625A6W0337055830, 1Z625A6W0315604957, 1Z625A6W0310221665, 1Z625A6W0308167345, 1Z625A6W0303168906, 1Z625A6W0333328909, 1Z625A6W0308525725, 1Z625A6W0324364717, 1Z625A6W0318497676, 1Z625A6W0322117667, 1Z625A6W0325856809, 1Z625A6W0323824883, 1Z625A6W0315904883

item.title: Report E-2022090807
item.description:
Report E-2022090807

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-13
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0811 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NAT. It was reported that approximately 25 gallons of UN2303, 3, III released from a 55 gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture while unloading. The release impacted the inside of trailer #DVAL5050. ERTS dispatched Miller Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 1100 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 gallons released to s 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area. The damage drum was containerized into an 85 gallon poly drum along with all cleanup debris. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On September 7, 2022, two (2) 55-gallon drums of Proplus V PC Magenta (contains UN1210) leaked during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to perform the necessary corrective actions. AOTC personnel containerized the two (2) damaged drums into two (2) 85-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

  • Description: 2,600 pounds of 50% Caustic Soda(Sodium hydroxide solution) was released to drains to the ponds as a result of overfilling the tanker during loading. Operator had just started loading a tanker load of 50% caustic from the storage tank to deliver next day. Then a tanker load of HCL came in which is in the same area(20 ft apart) but operator got focusd on the HCL and forgot about the caustic soda tanker. We lost 2,600 lbs of caustic. We were able to send it to the pond so no product got off site.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2022, four (4) plastic jerricans of Triple-D (contains corrosive liquid) released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the concrete loading dock due to a forklift puncture. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Huff's Environmental Services (HES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. HES personnel utilized absorbent wipes, then containerized all spent absorbents and damaged freight into one (1) 55-gallon drum to remediate the impacted surface.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/21/2022 at approxiamtely 2130, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee. 750823 at the ramp facility in Atlanta, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic bottle inside of a fiberboard box. The shipment showed visible staining. Further research revealed that the inner container was leaking due to a loose closure. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and await pick-up by the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2022081047
item.description:
Report E-2022081047

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-30
  • City: HOGANSVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/30/2022, ERTS received a request to dispatch a remediation contractor to address a potential hazardous release on Trailer 672149. Following contractor arrival and assessment of the involved cargo, it was determined that several boxes, each containing two single gallon containers of product, were damaged as the result of a load shift that occurred due to improper loading since the nose of the trailer was loaded with a single pallet followed by stacked side by side pallets loaded straight in leaving room for the pallets to shift due to there not being dunnage or lead securement in place. Media affected was subsequently neutralized and the cargo was reloaded and secured prior to departure. All waste was staged at the contractors location pending profiling and disposal.

  • Description: On July 27, 2022, one (1) 5-gallon jerrican containing UN3266 was damaged due to other freight being stacked on top and released approximately 0.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to perform the necessary corrective actions. MEG drummed the damaged container, then utilized absorbents and soda ash to remediate the impacted surface.

item.description:
Report E-2022080119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-14
  • City: Ellenwood
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the site, it was determined that a nail from the pallet had punctured the bottom drum head of one 55 gallon poly drum. This eventually resulted in the entire 55 gallons of liquid being released onto the trailer floor. The product had begun to dry by the time the contractor arrived. The contractor applied soda ash onto the trailer floor and bottoms of impacted pallets to neutralize them and solidify the small amount of remaining liquids.

item.title: Report E-2022070999
item.description:
Report E-2022070999

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-06
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 06,2022, Landstar notified ERTS of a leak of unknown material from Trailer 669479. Following contractor arrival and assessment, it was determined that two (2) gallons of product from a single 5-gallon pail of Ecolab Ultra San Sanitizer leaked when a load shifted, which caused pressure to be applied to the outside of the involved 5-gallon pail, which caused product to leak from the associated cap. Media affected was subsequently addressed via absorbents and waste generated, a single 55-gallon drum containing affected absorbents and damaged 5-gallon bucket pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022070523
item.description:
Report E-2022070523

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-13
  • City: COLLEGE PARK
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/13/22 a leaking drum was identiffied on Veolia's truck that was parked at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in College Park, GA. Further investigation revealed that the spill was caused from a pinhole leak in the drum located where a metal plate with the UN information was welded to the drum. There was less than 1 gallon of liquid was released. All of the liquid that was released was contained inside of the truck. When the release was first identified, the Velia Operations Manager was notified the team conducted a full investigation to perform remediation of the spill. The team put pads underneath the truck to make sure that nothing would get on the ground. Fortunately, no waste spilled out of the truck. The team cleaned up the spill with sodium bicarbonate and overpacked the leaking drum. The truck was then decontaminated further with sodium bicarbonate. The total time of the spill cleanup took approximately 3 hours. The 4 other drums of this waste did not leak.

item.title: Report E-2022070216
item.description:
Report E-2022070216

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-06
  • City: STONE MOUNTAIN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The van trailer in which this drum was loaded was picked up from Solvay Augusta on Tues. 7/5/22. The drum was not leaking at this time. The driver overnighted at a location and pre-tripped his truck and trailer the next day, Wed. 7/6/22. The drum was still secure. When the driver arrived at the Clean Harbors Environmental Services transportation Hub in Stone Mountain, GA., the trailer was being unloaded and the release was discovered. The point and cause of the release was found to be two small pin holes located approx. 1" from the bottom chime, apparently resulting from exterior corrosion. There was no evidence of the drum being punctured in-transit The released material was remediated by in-house technicians with proper HazMat Emergency Response training. The affected drum was over-packed, along with the contaminated remediation materials.

item.title: Report I-2022070819
item.description:
Report I-2022070819

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-03
  • City: Alpharetta
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINISTRATION CALLED THE STATION LOCATED IN ALPHARETTA GA TO INFORM THEM OF PACKAGE IN THEIR POSSESSION SUSPECTED OF CONTAINING UNDECLARED DANGEROUS GOODS. WHILE THE PACKAGE HAD NOT GONE OUT FOR DELIVERY, YET, IT WAS SCHEDULED TO BE DELIVERED THE NEXT BUSINESS DAY. A FRONT LINE EMPLOYEE RETRIEVED THE PACKAGE AND WITH HER MANAGER, AT THE REQUEST OF DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINISTRATION, OPENED THE PACKAGE TO INSPECT THE CONTENTS. IT WAS REPORTED THE PACKAGE WITH TRK# 776994107606 WAS A SMALL FEDEX BOX. THEY OPENED THE OUTER BOX AND FOUND THE CONTENTS TO BE 5 INDIVIDUAL BOXES OF AMMUNITION. PICTURES WERE TAKEN OF OUTER PACKAGING, INNER PACKAGING, AS WELL AS THE CONTENTS BOTH CLOSED AND OPEN TO CONFIRM CONTENTS. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKINGS NOR LABELS ON ANY PART OF THE PACKAGING TO INDICATE THERE WAS DANGEROUS GOODS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS REQUESTED HELD BY DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINISTRATION UNTIL FURTHER DISPOSITION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ripped and wet box was found. Spill was cleaned with proper ppe and the damage was placed in salvage drum. Due to the condition of the contents, it was assumed that the box was dropped during loading. DescribePack: Upon inspection of the damage, the caps were dented inwards and the seal along the sides were cracked and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill was cleaned with proper ppe and the damage was placed in salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2022070018
item.description:
Report E-2022070018

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-03
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0619 EST, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at the terminal. It was reported that approximately 1.5 gallons of Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid released due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct cleanup. At 0820 ET, Hepaco personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12 gallons of product released to a 6' x 15' area of the trailer floor and a 6' x 10' area of the asphalt lot below the trailer. The damaged drum was placed into a 55 gallon poly drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: ELLENWOOD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2022, one (1) battery was damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of acid to the concrete loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to perform the necessary corrective action. MEG personnel neutralized and absorbed the free product, then drummed the battery and spent absorbents.

item.description:
Report E-2022060347

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-04T21:08:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-09
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 9, 2022, two (2) 55-gallon drums of paint were punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the concrete loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to perform the necessary corrective action. HES personnel overpacked the damaged drums and utilized absorbents to remediate the impacted surface.
